title: Return of the Vorticons
content:
I stopped work on this a long time ago, but I thought I'd post it here just to see what you all thought of it. The gameplay is buggy, the graphics are sub-par, and the AI is primitive, but I made it using TGF a couple years back. Whether I finish it at all remains in doubt.

In any case, give it a go. There's two finished levels, plus a decent mini-game. Also, you can play 2 boss levels I made by pressing B on the main menu. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

[url=http://www.mediafire.com/?9llddrygvfy]Return of the Vorticons Demo[/url][img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: Return of the Vorticons
content:
Heh heh, a menu with clickable buttons. Always easy but annoying for keyboard games. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Rocketball doesn't respond to the angle it lands on the pad at all. Whatever.

Ooh! Default movement and counters for the [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] , heh.

If you ever finish this, I say do everything coding-related from scratch. It's quite cheesy. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] ____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].
